title: Visting the Bay Area
text:
In our 6 years of life here, we have come to love the East Bay and the greater Bay Area. We‚Äôll be overjoyed to have so many of our loved ones visiting for our wedding weekend. Whether you‚Äôre just looking for lodging recommendations, or planning to stay and explore beautiful California, you‚Äôll find some of our favorite recommendations below.
This is just a start, but we could talk about Berkeley, Oakland, San Francisco, Marin, Yosemite, Tahoe, etc. etc. etc. at great length! Feel free to reach out if you want any specific recommendations; we‚Äôll be so glad to help!




  
    
      
    
    Half Dome, Yosemite
  
  
  
    
      
    
    Golden Gate Bridge
  
  
  
    
      
    
    Berkeley Lab View

    Napa Valley
  


Where to Stay






The Gilman / Westbrae Neighborhood





This may not be a fair suggestion, as hotels are harder to come by, but this is our beloved neighborhood. We‚Äôll plan to host in our cozy home for parts of the weekend, so if you can find an AirBnb in our walkable neighborhood, you‚Äôll be close to the fun :)
Solano Ave. and North Berkeley BART are convenient from here.
For hotels, try:

The Berkeley Marina Double Tree
Aiden by Best Western










Downtown Berkeley





Downtown Berkeley is the city‚Äôs central location for restaurants and attractions. It‚Äôs near the beautiful UC Berkeley Campus and has access to the Downtown Berkeley BART Station - 1 stop from us. This neighborhood is also quite close to our ceremony venue, the UC Berkeley Botanical Garden!
You‚Äôll find hotels to pick from around here, and some restaurants dear to us (Jupiter?!?)
For hotels, try:

The Hilton Graduate Hotel
Hotel Shattuck Plaza
Berkeley City Club










Emeryville





Emeryville is proximate to Berkeley and Oakland and is famously home to Pixar Studio‚Äôs and America‚Äôs Bike Mayor. It‚Äôs a bike- and predestrian-friendly city with access to Berkeley and Oakland. There are a few hotels with views of the Bay here!
For hotels, try:

Hyatt House Emeryville
Hyatt Place Emeryville










San Francisco





Though across the bay, San Francisco is just a BART ride away (~ 25-30 minutes from Downtown Berkeley) and could be fun if you‚Äôre coming from the East Coast! If you‚Äôre hoping to get some site-seeing in, this could be for you!
For hotels, try:

Hotel Zetta
The Marker Hotel

We just chose these two hotels for their BART access, but we‚Äôre certain SF has loads of more beautful, comfortable hotels. Let us know if we can help you find one!





Our favorites
While you spend time in out beloved East Bay, why not check out some of our favorite spots?

title: Shane and Scout are Getting Married!
text:
Join us September 12th, 2025 in Berkeley, CA ‚ô°



Out Point Reyes Engagement!

title: Registry
text:
After seven wonderful years of building our home together, we‚Äôre so fortunate to have most of the household items we need. Please know that your presence at our celebration is truly the greatest gift to us. Having our loved ones from the East Coast, and from here, join us in Berkeley means everything. Quality time surrounded by the most supportive people in our lives is what we cherish most! We expect nothing more than your company on our special day.
For those who have asked about a registry, what would truly help us as we begin this new chapter would be contributions toward our future dreams - our honeymoon adventures and saving for our first house together.
We‚Äôre simply thankful to have you there to share in our joy, no matter what! üß°

title: Frivolity/Photos/FUN
text: We‚Äôre not doing engagement photos, but we happen to have 9 years of sweet and silly photos together. Enjoy these snapshots of our amazing life. üß° We love you! üß°

title: Our Wedding Weekend
text:
Click the date to see more about the celebrations in store.






‚úø Wednesday, September 10th (Just for fun!)






7 pm: Craft Night ‚Äì Our place üß∂

This is not a part of wedding weekend! If you are not normally in town for our weekly ‚ÄúWarm Wednesday‚Äù craft night,however, please know that you are most welcome if you‚Äôre in the area Wednesday night.











‚úø Thursday, September 11th






4 pm: Wedding Rehearsal ‚Äì UC Berkeley Botanical Garden Redwood Grove Amphitheatre üåø

Shane and Scout‚Äôs parents, our officiant, Shane and Scout

6 pm: Rehearsal Pizza Party ‚Äì Our place üè°

Totally optional, but everyone is welcome!











‚úø Friday, September 12th (The big day!)






Before 2 pm: Enjoy the UC Berkeley Botanical Gardensüå≤

Tell them you‚Äôre visiting for Shane and Scout‚Äôs wedding to enjoy free admission to one of the world‚Äôs most diverse plant collections. We hope you‚Äôll enjoy nerding out over the flora and taking celebratory photos :)

2 pm ‚Äì 4 pm: Wedding Ceremony ‚Äì UC Berkeley Botanical Garden Redwood Grove Amphitheatre üß°

Dress Code: Elevated, California Casual ‚Äì Our wedding will be relaxed and joyful‚Äîplease come in something you feel great in. No need for jackets or ties. Think: what you‚Äôd wear to a beautiful outdoor dinner with people you love.

5 pm ‚Äì 8 pm: Cocktail Hour and Dinner ‚Äì Location TBD

More to come!











‚úø Saturday, September 13th






11 am: Bagel Breakfast ‚Äì Our place üè°
1 pm: Beach Day - Limantour Beach, Point Reyes National Seashore

We want to spend our wedding weekend how we spend our time together - with good food, good company, and time outside! We‚Äôll coordinate carpools from Evelyn Avenue before spending the afternoon throwing frisbees, picnicking, and hopefully spotting some cool California fauna (there are elephant seals and California quail to be seen!).
